alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 4:45PM MDT until May 12 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding and minor stream and creek flows caused by recent rainfall and snowmelt is expected. Additional rain is expected through Saturday. * WHERE...Casper Mountain, especially near Bear Trap County Park and areas still with snowpack. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water is possible on driveways and gravel roads near creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM MDT, emergency management and public reports indicated minor flooding, along with snowmelt, in the advisory area. Elevated water levels are already occurring along portions of the Elkhorn Creek. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.50 inches are expected over the area through Saturday afternoon. This additional rain could result in minor flooding, especially combined with snowmelt. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beartrap Meadows County Park, Casper Mountain, Casper Mountain County Park and Rotary Park.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
